conclusion: Square ABCD with side length L and point charges at vertices: A: +q, B: +q, C: -q, D: -q. Need to find electric field at point O (center of the square).
The center of the square is equidistant from all four vertices, with distance r = L√2/2.

Direction of electric field from each charge: A (+q) and B (+q) repel positive charges, field points away from A and B toward center O; C (-q) and D (-q) attract positive charges, field points away from center O toward C and D.
Magnitude of electric field due to each charge is E_A = E_B = E_C = E_D = 2kq/L².
Coordinate system setup: center of square at origin, x-axis parallel to AB, y-axis parallel to AD. Positions of vertices: A: (-L/2, L/2), B: (L/2, L/2), C: (L/2, -L/2), D: (-L/2, -L/2).

Components of electric field from each charge: A (+q) has x-component -E_A/√2 and y-component E_A/√2; B (+q) has x-component -E_B/√2 and y-component -E_B/√2; C (-q) has x-component E_C/√2 and y-component -E_C/√2; D (-q) has x-component E_D/√2 and y-component E_D/√2.
Total x-component of electric field: E_x = 0.
Total y-component of electric field: E_y = 0.
The electric field strength at the center of the square is zero due to symmetrical arrangement of charges causing cancellation.
